metadata.title: CVE-2020-10766 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
A logic bug flaw was found in Linux kernel before 5.8-rc1 in theimplementation of SSBD. A bug in the logic handling allows an attacker witha local account to disable SSBD protection during a context switch whenadditional speculative execution mitigations are in place. This issue wasintroduced when the per task/process conditional STIPB switching was addedon top of the existing SSBD switching. The highest threat from thisvulnerability is to confidentiality.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-10766` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-186-generic - 4.4.0-186.216~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-186-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-186.216~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-186-lowlatency - 4.4.0-186.216~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-186-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-186.216~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-186-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-186.216~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-186-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-186.216~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-186-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-186.216~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-186-generic - 4.4.0-186.216~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-186-lowlatency - 4.4.0-186.216~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1075-aws - 4.4.0-1075.79
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1093-azure - 4.15.0-1093.103~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'was needs-triage ESM criteria').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-186.216~14.04.1').
linux-aws package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1075.79').
linux-azure package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1093.103~14.04.1').
